aspguidp.gui.status

Class ExecutionStatusManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • aspguidp.gui.status.ExecutionStatusManager

  • public class ExecutionStatusManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Manager class for the execution status of the application. The execution status of the application has two possible values. The value true means, that all input components of the application (InputElementController) are ready for execution of the logic program. The value false means, that at leas one input component of the application is not ready for execution of the logic program.

    An input component is not ready for the execution of the logic program, if the constraints of the component are not fulfilled (for example: if the data of an value input component is not valid).

    This status is used to update the clickability of the run button of the application (InputActionController). The button is clickable, if the execution status is true, which means that all input components of the application are ready for execution of the logic program.

    • Method Detail

      • registerElementReadyStatus

        public static void registerElementReadyStatus(javafx.beans.value.ObservableValue<java.lang.Boolean> readyToExecuteStatusValue)
        Register a new component execution status. This method is called by every input component, to register its own execution status. The application execution status is set to true, if all registered component execution status are true.
        Parameters:
        readyToExecuteStatusValue - execution status of the component

      • allElementsReadyProperty

        public static javafx.beans.property.ReadOnlyBooleanProperty allElementsReadyProperty()
